comments:
Running Eclipse-SDK-3.3M4 with Sun Java 1.6.0 on Windows XP SP1. Have some plugins in the workspace shared from dev.eclipse.org via pserver or extssh.

Selecting any file and choosing Team > Show History leaves and empty History window and produces the following entry in the PDE Errorlog:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.Error: Illegal character in port number at index 41: cvs://:extssh:moberhuber@dev.eclipse.org:!cvsroot!dsdp/org.eclipse.tm.rse/tests/org.eclipse.rse.tests/src/org/eclipse/rse/tests/internal/RSEConnectionManager.java?revision=1.4)
[...]
Caused by: java.lang.Error: Illegal character in port number at index 41: cvs://:extssh:moberhuber@dev.eclipse.org:!cvsroot!dsdp/org.eclipse.tm.rse/tests/org.eclipse.rse.tests/src/org/eclipse/rse/tests/internal/RSEConnectionManager.java?revision=1.4
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.filesystem.CVSURI.toURI(CVSURI.java:207)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.filehistory.CVSFileRevision.getURI(CVSFileRevision.java:82)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSHistoryTableProvider$HistoryLabelProvider.getFont(CVSHistoryTableProvider.java:243)


Most other cvs operations like synchronize, update, commit, diff work properly.
Reverting to Sun Java 1.5.0_10 also fixes the issue.

I believe this is a bug in the Java 1.6 URI class (i.e. our URI follows the spec and parsed fine in 1.4 and 1.5) . However, I have released a fix to HEAD that should work around the Java bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 168983 ***

traces.message: Illegal character in port number at index 41: cvs://:extssh:moberhuber@dev.eclipse.org:!cvsroot!dsdp/org.eclipse.tm.rse/tests/org.eclipse.rse.tests/src/org/eclipse/rse/tests/internal/RSEConnectionManager.java?revision=1.4
